clinical_study.brief_title: Safety Study of a Sutureless Amniotic Membran Transplantation to Treat Ocular Surface Disorders (Expanded Access)
clinical_study.official_title: Interventional Study to Investigate the Safety of a Combination of Amniotic Membrane and a Holder Device (AmnioClip) in the Therapy of Ocular Surface Disorders (Sutureless Amniotic Membrane Transplantation)

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators aimed at developing a technique to apply amniotic membrane to a diseased ocular surface without surgical intervention (sutureless amniotic membrane transplantation). This system needs to be concordant with laws and guidelines for the use of medical and pharmaceutical products.

detailed_description.textblock: A ring system (AmnioClip) was developed for mounting an amniotic membrane (AM) that can be applied like a large contact lens. AM is mounted between the two rings with a special designed, accessory mounting device. The safety of the ring system AmnioClip was tested in an interventional including 7 patients with ocular surface disorders and need for AM transplantation (1, 2, 3). About similar systems was reported (3, 4).

primary_outcome.measure: Slit lamp investigation of the inflammation status of the conjunctiva
primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expanded average of 3 month
primary_outcome.description: The ring of the AmnioClip touches the conjunctiva of the ocular surface. To prove side effects through the medical device the conjunctiva is controlled at every visit with microscopy using a slit lamp.

arm_group.description: Application of amniotic membrane device for 6-7 days.

intervention.description: The amniotic membrane ring system (AmnioClip) is device for sutureless application of amniotic membrane to oculare surfaces. Amniotic membrane is mounted between the two rings with a specially designed, accessory mounting device.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with ocular surface disorders and indication for amniotic membrane transplantation
- Willingness to provide signed Informed Consent Form
- For sexually active women of childbearing potential, use of an appropriate form of contraception (or abstinence) for the duration of the study
- Ability and willingness to return for all scheduled visits and assessments
Exclusion Criteria:
- An eye that, in the investigator's opinion, would not benefit from amniotic membrane transplantation
